info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 18 at 10:18AM CDT until May 22 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Louisville KY
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky...
Green River at Rochester affecting Butler, Ohio and Muhlenberg Counties.
.Heavy rain from the past couple of days will cause the river to rise.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Green River at Rochester.
* WHEN...Until early Thursday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 34.0 feet, Rochester Ferry stops operation. At 37.0 feet, Reeds and Rochester Ferries remain closed. KY 369 floods one mile north of Rochester.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 37.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 34.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM CDT Sunday was 37.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 37.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 37.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 39.0 feet on 03/22/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk.
The next statement will be issued by Monday morning at 700 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING

area.areaDesc: Butler, KY; Muhlenberg, KY; Ohio, KY
